subject: Ethics
title: Act vs. Rule Utilitarianism
description: A quick win: understand Act vs. Rule Utilitarianism.

hook.text: Lying to save a life maximizes happiness. Should you always lie when it helps?

buildup.text: Act utilitarianism says evaluate each action individually. Whatever produces most good wins.

discovery.text: Rule utilitarianism says follow the rule that, if everyone adopted it, would maximize welfare.

twist.text: Act util allows horrifying one-off exceptions. Rule util can become rigid and miss edge cases.

climax.text: The debate reveals a core tension: flexibility versus predictability in moral reasoning.

punchline.text: One judges the act. The other judges the policy.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between act and rule utilitarianism?
options: Act util evaluates individual actions; rule util evaluates general rules
Rule util rejects happiness as a goal
Act util only applies to governments
